title: Ed Stafford: I don’t care about big muscles – I just want to be alive for my son when I’m 87
text:
He's feasted on a giant bird-eating tarantula and sheltered his family under a makeshift hut during a ferocious Asian storm – but all British explorer Ed Stafford wants is to be alive for his son's adulthood. He tells Mark Bailey how he plans to get there

Ed Stafford faced gun-toting tribes and jungle predators when he became the first man to walk the 4,000-mile length of the Amazon in 2010, and his TV survival shows Naked and Marooned, Left For Dead and First Man Out see him suffering and starving in hazardous terrain.

So why, when he is now safely ensconced in the cosy rustic kitchen of his 17th-century home in the sleepy Leicestershire village of Hallaton, is he suddenly so worried about...
description: He's feasted on a giant bird-eating tarantula and sheltered his family under a makeshift hut during a ferocious Asian storm – but all British explorer Ed Stafford wants is to be alive for his son's adulthood.
